intro: Myosotis pseudopropinqua, commonly known as the New Zealand forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for native pollinators.
